nodes.bodyText: use enum type instead of string custom type?

initialize items with an empty array?
constructor(items?: readonly T[] = [])
This will avoid the if(items) check in the code
items?: readonly T[] is still an optional, hence it is needed to check undefined

why does the PipelineConfigPage accepts different arguments based on which page is rendered?
To avoid the complexity, can we create the entire pipeline model and pipeline-page always, regardless of the tab we're on?
And in the route setup, we just set the current-tab information, which will render appropriate content on the SPA.
We do not build smaller SPAs for each section of the pipeline config. There is only one SPA for the entire pipeline config. And based on the route, we render the SPA differently.

why does the PipelineConfigPage accepts different arguments based on which page is rendered?

This is done like this because of RoutedSinglePageApp implementation. According to this it is  entry point for the page and what to render is decided here it self.  Hence we need to decide the routes and component for the route at this level.

To avoid the complexity, can we create the entire pipeline model and pipeline-page always, regardless of the tab we're on?

Yes, that is something I had in mind but did not get time to refactor this piece of code. I was thinking of moving the tabs inside the page and based on route return the list of tabs to render. Take out the fetchData at the entry point to about API calls on route change.

We do not build smaller SPAs for each section of the pipeline config. There is only one SPA for the entire pipeline config. And based on the route, we render the SPA differently.

Agreed but route needs to be setup at this level based on design constraints.
